org.fosstrak.epcis.repository.query
Class QuerySubscriptionScheduled

java.lang.Object
  org.fosstrak.epcis.repository.query.QuerySubscription
      org.fosstrak.epcis.repository.query.QuerySubscriptionScheduled
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, EventListener, NotificationListener, EpcisQueryCallbackInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
QuerySubscriptionTriggered
public class QuerySubscriptionScheduled
extends QuerySubscription
implements NotificationListener, Serializable

Special case of Subscription (from subscribe() on query interface) where the subscription is scheduled.

Author:
Alain Remund, Arthur van Dorp
See Also:
Serialized Form

QuerySubscriptionScheduled

public QuerySubscriptionScheduled(String subscriptionID,
                                  QueryParams queryParams,
                                  String dest,
                                  Boolean reportIfEmpty,
                                  Calendar initialRecordTime,
                                  Calendar lastTimeExecuted,
                                  Schedule schedule,
                                  String queryName)
                           throws ImplementationExceptionResponse
Constructor to be used when recreating from storage.

Parameters:
subscriptionID - The subscription ID.
queryParams - Query parameters.
dest - The destination URI.
reportIfEmpty - Whether to report when nothing changed.
initialRecordTime - The initial record time.
lastTimeExecuted - The last time the query was executed.
schedule - The query Schedule.
queryName - The query name.
Throws:
ImplementationException - If the Scheduler could not be started.
ImplementationExceptionResponse
Method Detail

stopSubscription

public void stopSubscription()
Stops the re-execution of the schedule. This method is called when a subscribed query get's unsubscribed.

finalize

protected void finalize()
The Object has definitely been destroyed. This may take a while.

handleNotification

public void handleNotification(Notification pNotification,
                               Object pHandback)
This method is handles a notification when the Timer for the schedule times out.

Specified by:
handleNotification in interface NotificationListener
Parameters:
pNotification - The Notification.
pHandback - A Timer stating the time when the Notification should be invoked.
